title: Bike Service on the Empire Builder Portland to Spokane Route

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All records regarding projects to install bike racks on the Portland to Spokane section of the Empire Builder between 1 January 2017 and 1 August 2023.
- All records regarding projects to facilitate carry on bike service on the Portland to Spokane section of the Empire Builder between 1 January 2017 and 1 August 2023.

The existence of such information is suggested by responses provided by Amtrak to The League of American Bicyclists in 2017. The responses can be found on pages 16 and 22 respectively in this document: https://bikeleague.org/sites/default/files/Amtrak_answers.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Schmitz

title: Child care stabilization grant info request

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Child care stabilization grant info request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Databases or information related to DHHS' child care stabilization grants in Arkansas. Specifically, information at the grant-to-provider level, including a list of providers who were awarded the grants, addresses, licensed capacity, and amounts awarded.

If available, information on the process of applying for the grants, information on the process of allocating the grants, information about rejected applications, and information on any other grants available to providers from the state.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Gabrielle Pepin.

communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: R112227-082023
communications.communication:
Dear Lewis Manning: 
 
Thank you for your interest in the public records of the Austin Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 8/20/2023 and given the reference number R112227-082023 for tracking purposes. 
Please be advised that the Austin Police Department’s Central Records Division receives over 2500 requests for information a month. These requests are processed in the order received, and we strive to respond to each request promptly, as required by law. 
Please know that, as a result of the large volume of requests received, the anticipated timeframe for responding to your request may take 10 business days if it is simply an offense report you're requesting.  If you are requesting body cam, dash cam, or other related records your request could take up to 30 days. 
You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records requested. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Austin Public Records Center. 
Austin Police Department

title: Local Law 39 violation forms, documentation and database schema

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Local Law 39 violation forms, documentation and database schema
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All citation forms, inspection manuals and database dictionaries that will be used to identify, document and organize inspections and violations under Local Law 39, a new law regulating e-bikes and e-scooters.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: BOP FOIA 2023-03329 meta FOIA

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Michael Cohen through his lawyer filed a FOIA request and got nothing back. https://x.com/michaelcohen212/status/1692609200583541078?s=46&t=axhEpTt0OokaaS32ajEiQA. We are unable to tell why. So, I am requesting these records: 

1. The FOIA request which you assigned tracking number 2023-03329

2. The tracking sheet your agency used to track the progress of this FOIA request 

3. Any agency communications describing whether and how to respond to this FOIA request 

and 

4. A copy of the documents that responsive to the FOIA request. For this part, please note that some may need to be partially redacted. In your adjudication letter, you threw in a laundry list of exemption codes, but these likely don’t justify withholding 873 pages in full. For B7A specifically, the mere pendency of enforcement proceedings is an inadequate basis for the invocation of B7(A) with showing that some distinct harm could reasonably be expected to result if the record or information requested were disclosed. Miller v. USDA, 13 F.3d 260, 263 (8th Cir. 1993)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Matthew Hoppock

communications.communication:
Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records related to Jeffrey S. Bromme in his professional capacity as an attorney, he is an employee of AdventHealth  (also known as Adventist Health System and formerly known as Florida Hospital) as Chief Legal Officer and is or was a member of the Texas Bar, from 2010 to 2023 (present day).  In the event that this request is overly broad or produces results in excess of 100, please let me know and I will clarify further. It is noted after reviewing responsive documents from the Florida Bar Association, that he is or was a member of the State of Texas Bar.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request, though I grant permission for fees up to $25. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available. I request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs. If that is not possible, I prefer a CD-ROM or a USB drive as a secondary alternative.

I would also appreciate an approximate time frame for this request to  be processed.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

If there are no responsive records for some reason, then I revise the scope to be the DHS in general, but to exclude the specific agencies with which the DHS has oversight over. communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: C192956-081823
communications.communication:
Dear : 
Thank you for contacting the City of Austin. Your request was received in this office on 8/18/2023 and given the reference number C192956-081823 for tracking purposes. Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City departments to locate the information you seek. 
Records Requested: August 17, 2023
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
copies of reports, lists, databases, or individual documents that details civil and/or criminal lawsuits of police misconduct brought against the city's police officers and/or the department by civilians or protesters who were injured during the 2020 George Floyd Protests from May 2020 to December 2021. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
Through this request, I am gathering information on the copies of the three lawsuits because this information is being sought on behalf of NYCity News Service for dissemination to the general public. 
Please waive any applicable fees. Release of the information is in the public interest because it will contribute significantly to public understanding of government operations and activities. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is of timely value, I would appreciate your communicating with me by phone or email, if you have questions regarding this request.
Please provide expedited processing of this request which concerns a matter of urgency. As a journalist, I am primarily engaged in disseminating information. The public has an urgent need for information about the copies of the three lawsuits because I certify that my statements concerning the need for expedited processing are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and belief.
Thank you in advance for your time. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within five business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Brianna Knibbs
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Brianna Knibbs

title: CPS Budget Status Reports FY23

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS Budget Status Reports FY23
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a tabular export of the "Budget Status Report" for all CPS schools, as provided to principals and approved by LSCs for FY23.

An example of such a report is linked here as a PDF. Please include the same data. If it is necessary to break it up into multiple tabs or spreadsheets, that's fine. 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1THS1IqKCBxlc8pA7KF1XE6rTWpHV0DpF/view?usp=sharing 

Please note these budgets were not just cited and identified, but required by CPS to be presented and approved at public meetings. Consequently they are explicitly excluded from the preliminary draft exemption under 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(f): "a specific record or relevant portion of a record shall not be exempt when the record is publicly cited and identified by the head of the public body." 

 Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or require clarification.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Moser

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

08/21/2023 

Anthony Moser 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR150962 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Anthony: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014080-082023 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

title: Call for Service and incident Report

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Call for Service and incident Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, my name is Dhruv Mehrotra and I am a reporter with WIRED magazine. I am looking for for records relating to a 911 call and dispatch made on August 11 2023.  

According to news reports, a 3-year-old child riding one of Texas’ migrant buses died while on the way to Chicago, officials said Friday. The Illinois Department of Public Health said the child was 3 years old and died Thursday in Marion County. 

The Texas Division of Emergency Management said in a statement that, “Once the child presented with health concerns, the bus pulled over and security personnel on board called 9-1-1 for emergency attention.”

I am looking for the recording of this 911 call for service as well as any incident report and dispatch log relating to the event.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: FOIA Request - Jarad Anthony Higgins (Juice WRLD)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request - Jarad Anthony Higgins (Juice WRLD)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 ILCS 140), I hereby request the following records:

All records within the your agency's possession, irrespective of timeframe, and with respect to following criteria: 
1. All records related to Jarad Anthony Higgins, better known as Juice WRLD, related to his death on December 8th, 2019.  It is noted that one or more officers from the Chicago PD, were present or informed by dispatched about Jarad, on or about the time of his death. 
2. All records related to Jarad A. Higgins being under investigation leading up to his death such as surveillance records, reports, memos, emails, and so on as well as all records after his death.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. I request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV, or XLS file), to avoid copying costs. 

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

If you have any questions or concerns, or if I can provide any clarification that so as to focus, clarify, or narrow this request, please do not hesitate to contact me 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statue requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

title: UA1502 - August 11 - Passenger Incident

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: UA1502 - August 11 - Passenger Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all 9-1-1 call recordings/reports, police reports, and/or officer body cam footage regarding an incident on Friday, August 11th at Chicago O'Hare Airport on United Airlines flight 1502 at approximately 12:30pm regarding a passenger on the plane.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tommy West

title: Heath related deaths in Louisiana

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Heath related deaths in Louisiana
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records related to the deaths in the state of Louisiana related to heat exposure starting from January 1 2020 to August 16 2023. Specifically, I request this information as a data set or spreadsheet that includes the following information (if available):

Case Number
Name of Deceased
Age of Deceased
Birthdate of Deceased
Gender
Race
Ethnicity (please note if Hispanic/Latino)
Date of Death
Manner of Death
Primary Cause(s)
Secondary Cause(s)
Incident Address or Place of Death (including city and zip code)
Residence Address (including city and zip code)
Pronouncement Address (including hospital name if applicable)
Notifying Agency
Autopsy (if applicable)

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $20. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of coronavirus cases in Orleans Parish. I am a journalist at the Guardian, which is a public interest news organization, and this information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

Section 44:32(D) of the Louisiana Public Records Act requires a response within three business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than that time period, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. I can be reached at any time at 646-726-1894 or oliver.laughland@theguardian.com.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. If only partial information is available, please release only the partial information to me.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Oliver Laughland

title: Email Log: Chief of Staff, July 2023

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all emails to/from Lauro Roman, currently Chief of Staff to the CEO from July 1, 2023 through July 31, 2023.

1. Please search all of his CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N014063-081623
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

08/17/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR150909 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014063-081623 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - AdventHealth
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., I hereby request the following records:

All records related to AdventHealth also known as Adventist Health System from 2019 to 2023 (to the date of the day of processing) with respect to contracts and legal documents and within your agency's possession, the City of Altamonte Springs. More specifically, I request contracts and other legal documents that are in effect during the time frame specified.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I grant permission for fees up to $30. If the fees are still in excess of $30, please let me know as well as the number of results produced and I will further revise the criteria. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

communications.communication:
Good Morning,
We are in receipt of your public records request with the City of Altamonte Springs. Your request will be provided to the appropriate department that maintains this information. Please be advised that all requests are processed in the order in which they are received.
If the information is available electronically, and does not require extensive research time, there will be no charge. The City does charge $0.15 (single sided, up to 11” x 17”) per page for copies that are not available electronically. Actual cost of duplication will apply for copies larger than 11” x 17”. Also, if extensive research time is involved, an hourly fee will apply. You will be advised of all fees prior to beginning any work on this request.
If we need more information, a deposit to proceed with research, or once your request is complete, we will be in touch.
PLEASE CLICK REPLY ALL WHEN RESPONDING OR SEND NEW INQUIRIES TO CITYCLERK@ALTAMONTE.ORG<mailto:CITYCLERK@ALTAMONTE.ORG>.

Thank you,


ALISA PRINCE
P: (407) 571-8119
Deputy City Clerk
F: (407) 571-8123
APrince@altamonte.org<mailto:APrince@altamonte.org>
[cid:image001.png@01D8849C.E61A2F70]<http://www.altamonte.org/>
202 Newburyport Avenue
Altamonte Springs, FL 32701
www.Altamonte.org<http://www.altamonte.org>
[Facebook]<https://www.facebook.com/cityofaltamonte/>
[Twitter]<https://twitter.com/CityofAltamonte>
[Instagram]<https://www.instagram.com/cityofaltamontesprings/>
Information provided in this email is subject to disclosure to the public pursuant to Florida Sunshine Law. Email sent on the City system is considered public and is only withheld from disclosure if deemed confidential pursuant to state law.

Persons with disabilities needing documents in an alternate format should contact
(407) 571-8122 (Voice), (407) 571-8126 (TTY) or CityClerk@altamonte.org<mailto:CityClerk@altamonte.org> (Email).

title: Hazelwood PD FOIA Logs 2021, 2022

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Hazelwood PD FOIA Logs 2021, 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Your agency's Freedom of Information Request logs for calendar years of 2021 and 2022. These logs should include a request date, description of records requested, requester organization (if applicable) and current status of the requests.

Further, I request that this document be sent in any digital formats in which it exists (such as PDF and Excel). Under the terms of the E-FOIA Amendments of 1996, Section 5, if a document exists in electronic format, it must be released in that format upon request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Hazelwood PD FOIA Logs 2021, 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following The Missouri Sunshine Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on Aug. 16, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Request for Public Records - Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Kevin,

This e-mail servers to acknowledge we have received your request for public records.  As the information spans two years and involves a combined total of over 650 requests, the City will require time to compile the information.

I will be in contact with you regarding status by close of business on Friday, August 18th.

Thanks.


Emery L. Ransom
Deputy City Clerk
City of Maryland Heights
11911 Dorsett Road
Maryland Heights, MO  63043
Phone: (314) 738-2213
Fax:  (314) 738-2413

eransom@marylandheights.com<mailto:jcova@marylandheights.com>
